titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. J. H. Husbands, Indictment
CWG5146

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Kentucky
County of Graves } SS.
Graves Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
Against
J. H Husbands.

The grand Jury of Graves County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse J H Husbands of the crime of robbery committed as follows to wit The said J H Husbands did on the 18th day of May 1863 in the County aforesaid go in company with a band of lawless desperadoes and co-adjutors who are unknown to the grand Jury to the dwelling House of K Basford and feloniously took & carried away a gun worth twenty Dollars and a pistol worth fifteen dollars the personal property of K Basford from he presence of Mrs Minerva Basford the wife, & Miss Lucy Ann Basford the daughter of the said K Basford the said wife & daughter being at the time the legally & authorized custodians of the said property. Against the peace & dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

P.D. Yeiser
Commonwealth attorney for 1 Judical District

Witness Miss Lucy Ann Basford
Mrs minerva Basford & K Basford

Endorsed.
Bail is fixed on this indictment at
Five Hundred dollars
C. S. Marshall

A true Bill
H. S. Anderson, foreman

Filed May 23d 1863
W A Turner c g c c

A Copy attest
W A Turner c g c c

Commlth
vs } Robbery
J. H Husbands
(Copy)
